title: Parents of teen 'killed by diplomat's wife' demand judicial review into immunity
text:
Lawyer’s for the teenager’s family want to see the advice given to police regarding the decision to grant diplomatic immunity to the suspect in his death (Picture: Shutter Up for DailyMail.com)

Lawyers for the family of Harry Dunn have asked the government to hand over documents relating to the decision to grant diplomatic immunity to the American suspect in his death.

Anne Sacoolas, 42, who is reportedly married to a US intelligence official, left the UK just days after the crash outside RAF Croughton which killed the 19-year-old on August 27.

Harry’s mother, Charlotte Charles, and father, Tim Dunn, have travelled to the States to highlight their case and told a press conference in New York they felt let down by the call.

Radd, Seiger, the family’s spokesman, said their lawyers are now prepared to launch a full investigation into the Foreign and Commonwealth Office’s (FCO) advice to Northamptonshire Police.

‘We are going to write to the FCO very shortly, explaining that we don’t want to do a judicial review, but to avoid that please let us have the following documents – all e-mails, messages, notes in relation to your advice to Northamptonshire Police that this lady had it (diplomatic immunity),’ he explained.

‘What we don’t know is whether somebody cocked up or whether they were put under pressure by the Americans to concede.

Harry Dunn was killed in an collision near RAF Croughton in Northamptonshire on 27 August (Picture: Instagram)

Anne Sacoolasis the wife of US diplomat Jonathan Sacoolas (Picture: Enterprise News and Pictures)

Harry’s mother, Charlotte Charles, travelled to the States to publicise her case (Picture: Reuters)

The motorcyclist’s father Tim Dunn said ‘someone has made a mistake’ over the call (Picture: Reuters)

‘We want to conduct an investigation into the FCO’s decision to advise Northamptonshire Police that this lady had the benefit of diplomatic immunity.

‘If we’re not satisfied, then we’ll go to a judicial review and ask a High Court judge to review it all.’

Harry’s father told reporters on Monday that ‘someone has made a mistake’.

‘Somewhere, somebody has made a decision to give this lady immunity,’ he said.

‘She’s not entitled to immunity as it’s been said and we’ve known that from the start.

‘They made a mistake, someone has made a mistake.’

Mrs Sacoolas broke her silence over the teenager’s death last weekend when she issued a statement saying she was ‘devastated by this tragic accident’.

It went on to say she ‘would like to meet with Mr Dunn’s parents so that she can express her deepest sympathies and apologies’.

description: The parents of Harry Dunn want to see the FCO's advice to Northamptonshire Police about granting Anne Sacoolas diplomatic immunity.
